newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE Oct white sugar hits new high, backs off.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE Oct white sugar hits new high, backs off.

text.p: Steady commission house buying drove London's October white sugar contract to a fresh life high on Monday morning but other players were quick to move in and take profits, traders said.
One major commission house was said to have led the morning's buying spree, thought to be on behalf of fund clients, with the gains then capped by trade and brokers.
"There's very good resistance at $331...maybe it's done what it wants to do for the moment," said one trader.
October rallied to a new high of $331.00 after moving in a range of $2.00. Other positions also gained ground.
Traders said they were continuing to monitor the build-up in fund positions in the London market.
At 1100 GMT October was up $1.40 at $330.10 and December up $1.00 at $324.30. Volume was concentrated in the spot contract and amounted to 683 lots.

The Paris market was also strong but volume was on the light side at just 140 lots. October was up 80 cents at $329.80 and December up 30 cents at $323.30. --Jeremy Smith, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8064
